name: Jean-Philippe Bossuat
bio:
Jean-Philippe Bossuat started working on lattice-based fully homomorphic encryption in 2019 at the Laboratory for Data Security (LDS) at EPFL.

During his time at the LDS, Jean-Philippe co-authored the library Lattigo, a well established Go module that implements Ring-Learning-With-Errors based homomorphic-encryption and Multiparty-Homomorphic-Encryption based protocols.

He is currently employed at Tune Insight SA as a cryptography software engineer specialized in fully homomorphic encryption. 

His work focuses on maintaining the Lattigo library to the state-of-the-art, and researching, designing, implementing and optimizing FHE-based applications for privacy-preserving analytics and machine learning.
